page.title: 01Rural South-West Rutland.
page.content:
This D-Block covers the villages of Bisbrooke, Seaton and Harringworth and their immediate environs. All three villages are small - probably no more than fifty houses in each one - and they are surrounded by rolling arable farmland. Each village has a church and a pub, but Harringworth is the only one with a shop.
Each village is picturesque in its own way, being a mixture of pretty cottages and modern stone houses. The dwellings are usually enhanced by attractive gardens, in June a mass of multi-coloured roses.
The dominant architectural feature of the area is the Harringworth, Seaton, or Welland Viaduct, over one hundred years old.
